meanings.definition: The act of freezing or becoming frozen.
meanings.sent1: The freezings of the ice cream made it too hard to scoop.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the freezings in my fingers as I walked through the snowstorm.
meanings.sent3: The freezings in the freezer were so cold, they turned my hand numb.
meanings.sent4: The freezings of fear gripped her heart as she heard the strange noise in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The freezings of winter transformed the landscape into a sparkling wonderland.

meanings.sent1: The freezings of the lake prevented us from skating on it.
meanings.sent2: The freezings of the meat kept it fresh for a long time.
meanings.sent3: The freezings of the computer screen made it impossible to work.
meanings.sent4: The freezings of time seemed to slow down as we waited for the train.
meanings.sent5: The freezings of the river created a beautiful icy landscape.

meanings.sent1: The freezings of the water turned it into solid ice.
meanings.sent2: The freezings of the vegetables preserved them for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The freezings of the popsicle were so quick, it surprised the kids.
meanings.sent4: The freezings of the liquid nitrogen amazed the science students.
meanings.sent5: The freezings of the Arctic Ocean formed a thick layer of ice.
